revised_title: A Letter Describing the September 30, 1750 Earthquake in Northamptonshire
tldr: This article contains accounts of the September 30, 1750 earthquake experienced in Northamptonshire and its surrounding areas. The author, John Nixon, shares his own experience and includes letters from Thomas Cave and the Reverend Minister of Weston with Sutton, detailing the shock and its effects on the local communities. The accounts describe the violent shaking, loud noise, and confusion caused by the earthquake, and mention that no significant damage was reported.
